Normal: Use restrained, natural prose. Do not rely on flowery language, lyrical excess, or metaphor as a primary device. Prefer simple, well-shaped sentences, precise verbs, and concrete detail. Trust scenes, behavior, and dialogue to carry emotion rather than decorative language. The writing should feel grounded, contemporary, and human.
Fantasy: Write with wit, clarity, and light-footed humor. Let comedy arise from character, timing, and practical absurdity rather than ornate language or epic posturing. Keep the prose lean and conversational; avoid florid description, extended metaphors, and mock-heroic excess. Favor precise observation, dry understatement, and clean sentence rhythm. The tone should feel clever, humane, and quietly mischievous.
Spicy: Write explicit, immersive erotica with a focus on physical sensation, emotional immediacy, and moment-to-moment experience. Use concrete, sensory detail and precise verbs; avoid euphemism, coy vagueness, and flowery metaphor. Keep the language grounded in bodies, reactions, and desire rather than poetic abstraction.
